titleStmt.title: The woody queristers when birds could speak, and women they, had neither good nor ill to say? The pritty birds fill'd with pain, did to each other, thus complain. To the tune of, The bird-catchers delight.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for I. Clarke, W. Thackeray, and T. Passinger,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Oh! says the Cuckcow, loud and stout ..."
Cf. Wing W3522B which has "querristers" in the title.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
